description:
Meyerozyma guilliermondii ATCC 6260 is a species of yeast that belongs to the phylum Ascomycota. It is a member of the Saccharomycetales order and the Meyerozyma genus.

This yeast is typically found in the environment, including soil, water, and the gastrointestinal tract of various animals. It is known to have a wide range of applications, including in the food and beverage industries, as well as in the production of various enzymes and metabolites.

Meyerozyma guilliermondii ATCC 6260 is a unicellular, ellipsoidal or ovoid-shaped yeast that reproduces asexually through budding. It is typically white or cream-colored and can form colonies on agar media.

This particular strain, ATCC 6260, has been widely studied and used in various research and industrial applications. It is known for its ability to assimilate a wide range of carbon and nitrogen sources, making it a versatile organism for various biotechnological processes.
